Thesis 2

Those who have enclosed the open internet now sell you the story that true freedom was something from the eighties â€” and almost everyone falls for it.

In 1989, you bought a computer, plugged in a cable, dialed a number, and you were online with the whole world â€” without an account, without permission, without five gatekeepers watching to see if you were allowed.

Today, you buy a phone and you are first a customer of Apple or Google, then a tenant of Meta or Amazon, and only then â€” if you behave â€” are you allowed to do something.

They call that chain â€œconvenienceâ€ and â€œsecurityâ€, so you forget that freedom was once simple, direct, and without gatekeepers.
